main_definition: To perform poorly or inadequately, often used to describe something that is unpleasant or unsatisfactory.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To draw into the mouth by suction or a similar action
meanings_and_examples.example: The baby would suck on his pacifier when he was fussy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be ineffective or lacking quality, often used to describe something that is disappointing or unsatisfactory
meanings_and_examples.example: I hate this movie; it really sucks compared to the others I've seen from the same director.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To attempt to persuade someone using flattery or deceit
meanings_and_examples.example: He tried to suck up to his boss by constantly complimenting her work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A slang term indicating dissatisfaction or disappointment with a situation, person, or thing
meanings_and_examples.example: That concert was a total flop. It just didn't live up to the hype and honestly sucked.
